intro: Tetramolopium spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, featuring hairy stems and oval, leathery leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Tetramolopium spathulatum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
